newsitem.title: USA: Tennessee Gov. signs $14.5 billion budget.
newsitem.headline: Tennessee Gov. signs $14.5 billion budget.

text.p: Tennessee Gov. Don Sundquist signed the state's $14.5 billion budget into law unchanged from the version passed by the General Assembly.
The budget, signed Monday, reduces the number of state employees by 753 and phases out another 1,015 jobs to save $50 million.
It also reduces the state's contribution to the Tennessee Consolidated Retirement Fund to $200 million from $300 million pending the outcome of an actuarial study.
Most of the estimated $93 million in savings will provide a 1.5 percent pay raise for state employees, said Leslie Higinbotham, a spokeswoman for Sundquist.

The state retirement fund pays benefits to about 65,000 retired state workers. State officials said the contribution could be reduced because the $17.5 billion fund has more than it needs to meet long-term commitments.
